Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Quod \Quod\, v. Quoth; said. See {Quoth}. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
``Let be,'' quod he, ``it shall not be.'' --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Quod \Quod\ (kw[o^]d), v. t. To put in quod, or prison; to lock up; to jug. [Slang] --Kipling.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Quod \Quod\ (kw[o^]d), n. [For quad, abbrev. of quadrangle.] A quadrangle or court, as of a prison; hence, a prison. [Slang] ``Flogged or whipped in quod.'' --T. Hughes. [1913 Webster]
